div.div: The E.O. Smith Chamber Singers have been selected as a performing/showcase ensemble at the 2020 ACDA Division Conference (The American Choral Directors Association), in Rochester, New York, March 5, 2020. The Eastern Division of ACDA is comprised of 12 states. 13 choirs were chosen (through a blind audition process) as ensembles who exemplify excellence in the choral arts and we are 1 of 3 high school choirs to receive this incredible honor.
div.a: Read More About E.O. Smith Chamber Singers

div.div: E.O. Smith’s senior Ethan Stone has been named one of the 15,000 Semifinalists who has advanced to Finalist standing in the 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program! National Merit Finalists will compete for one of 2,500 National Merit $2,500 scholarships. The awards will be announced this spring. This is the 65th year of the prestigious program, which honors academically talented high school seniors who are selected on the basis of their skills, accomplishments, and potential success in rigorous college studies. Congratulations, Ethan!
div.a: Read More About 2020 National Merit Scholarship

div.div: The Starmakers Theater is part of EO Smith School’s Unified and Drama Programs.
div.a: Read More About Starmakers Theater January 2020

div.div:
E.O. Smith High School is comprised of a diverse group of students from all over eastern CT who come together to create a culture that supports individual and community growth. We are committed to preparing all of our students for a variety of post-secondary educational and career opportunities. In addition to academic success, we care deeply about the health and well-being of every student and offer a variety of supports to ensure their success.
Please click on the link below to see what makes E.O. Smith High School exceptional.
The Top 10 Reasons to Attend EO
